alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 28 at 10:09PM MST until March 04 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. .Over an inch of rain has fallen over North Idaho. Light to moderate rain will continue into Wednesday. Warmer temperatures and windy conditions will result in increasing snow melt. The combination of rain and snowmelt will result in excess runoff and potential for rivers to rise, some which could reach minor flood stage this week. For the St Joe and Coeur d`Alene Rivers...minor flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Minor flooding of farmland from Cataldo downstream to Harrison is likely. The campground at Cataldo will also begin to flood. Portions of Dudley Road, west of Latour Creek, will likely be underwater and impassable. If there is significant water already in the floodplain, these impacts may occur at lower stages. Old Coeur d`Alene River Road on the North Fork of the Coeur d`Alene River may begin to flood north of the Bumblebee Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PST Monday the stage was 33.6 feet. - The river is starting to respond to recent rains with slow rises observed over the last six hours. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.Tuesday morning at 930 AM PST.
